ReRead.  I said the Mage beat the Ocean by FREEZING TIME not by 
heartburst.  Of course, I do not get any points for beating the level 
that way, but I did beat it.  Darn, my mega-archmage can not summon 
indestructible fire elementals over water.  I can understand not being 
able to summon images, but not summoning elementals is a different 
matter.  I mean if I want to put my archmage's life in danger by 
summoning a fire elemental of water, that is my business not the the 
designers of the game's business.  However, I think I can beat the 
ocean by just waiting it out and avoiding getting hit by anybody 
because I have so much health power.

On the positive note, my levels are passing tests for not being too 
difficult.  I make notes of the scenarios and things I changed from 
the original and put that in a text file attached to the scenarios.  I 
will continue on my plan to build more difficult levels.  Yes, I will 
be cracking down on how many opponents you face, but beware: very few 
opponents = very high experience level opponents.  I will still stick 
to my plan of making very level potentially worth millions of special, 
even if it means I have to high level gold and silver to accomplish 
this.  

BTW, Tevildo, how did you like my placement of gold and silver in the 
the 'hedge' scenarios?
